summary: 📌 Disease: Durian Allocaridara Attack (Allocaridina cornea infestation) 💥 Cause: This disease is caused by small crustaceans, known as mites (Allocaridina cornea), which burrow into the durian's flesh. 😷 Symptoms: Symptoms include small, white, rice-like objects moving under the durian skin and rapid yellowing of the fruit. 💊 Treatment & Prevention: Treatment involves the use of pesticides. Prevention includes proper sanitation, avoiding overcrowding of plants, and using clean knives and tools when handling durians. Regularly check durians for early signs of infestation.
